item.title: +560k housing units for NYC by 2030
item.description: A recent study suggests that NYC needs to build 560k additional units overall by 2030. Since the NYC’s government publicly tracks only the number of affordable housing units getting built, I’ve started a tracker that compiles all active and potential legislative initiatives that could yield more housing in order to establish a concrete sense of our current trajectory, and make clear if and how that is insufficient. Note that the 560 units target should probably be considered a bare minimum.
